title: Bug - Game Crashing, can not reload in.
body:
This happens to me every now and then probably once every 20 games or so and has been getting annoying.

Basically everything is  find and normal for a while and then at some point the game freezes and I end up with something like the video I posted.

That video was taken after trying to restart the client then my computer and finally trying the repair  button on login.

As can be seen the game is completely un-playable and essentially loses my team the game.

This occurred about 10 min in but I have experience it occuring much later (Like 40 min) as well.

Does anyone have any idea what might be causing this/ what I can do to fix it??

I'm happy to provide any more info as required.

replies.body:
Hey there,

Could you do the following for me,

* [Download WinMTR](https://sourceforge.net/projects/winmtr/files/WinMTR-v092.zip/download) and run a traceroute to the following IP. (Allow this to run for 5-15 minutes)
  * 103.240.227.5
* Once adequate time has passed, stop the traceroute, export your results as text.
* Run the [ICSI netalyzr](http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/).
* Post back with a link to your WinMTR results (You can use [pastebin](http://pastebin.com/) for this) and a link to your ICSI netalyzr results.

Okay so the ICSI netalyzr data is:

http://pastebin.com/XbLDEKG6

Hope this helps.

Apologies for the late reply.

Are you still experiencing this issue?

I notice some packet loss on your ISP's end of things, this could be causing your issue that looks like "lag", I'd recommend contacting them regarding this.

There are a few other things you can change based on your ICSI netalyzr results (Although they're very hard to read on pastebin, in the future you should link directly to your results page)

* [Switch to a public DNS](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq5)
* [Ensure your time is synced with an internet time server](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761944-Login-Issues#wq3)
